duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform planned preventive maintenance, calibrations where certification may be required and electrical safety inspections on imaging and related equipment in compliance with established standards

Perform major repairs by replacing defective components, readjust components to manufacturer’s specifications using appropriate tools and measuring instruments. May require certification in order to complete repairs
Assist with diagnostic imaging cross training of BMET Technicians
Confer with manufacturer’s representatives and equipment operators to resolve equipment related problems
Research and initiate orders for repair parts, working within established budget parameters
Conduct and compile Quality Assurance records and reports necessary for compliance with specifications and policies
Document all significant asset related actions in compliance with department practices
Must be capable of performing all the duties and responsibilities of a BMET III

education_certification.credential: Associate's degree in Electronics/Imaging Technology, Biomedical Equipment Technology, or military training (Bachelor's degree preferred)
Certification (CRES) in specialized modalities such as radiology, MRI, nuclear medicine, ultrasound, CT, cath. lab., linear accelerators, etc.
